009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line.utils;
010
011import java.util.Random;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Instances of this class are used to randomly sample points along a given
018 * straight line segment, x/y coordinates being perturbed with Gaussian noise.
019 * Mainly used for testing line fitters.
020 * </p>
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 * @version 2022/09/29
024 * 
025 */
026public class LineSampler {
027        
028        private final Random rg;
029        private final Pnt2d p1, p2;
030        
031        /**
032         * Constructor (with no specific seed).
033         * @param p1 first point of the line segment
034         * @param p2 second point of the line segment
035         */
036        public LineSampler(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2) {
037                this(p1, p2, 0);
038        }
039        
040        /**
041         * Constructor (with specific random seed).
042         * @param p1 first point of the line segment
043         * @param p2 second point of the line segment
044         * @param seed random seed (pass 0 for complete randomness)
045         */
046        public LineSampler(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, long seed) {
047                this.p1 = p1;
048                this.p2 = p2;
049                this.rg = (seed == 0) ? new Random() : new Random(seed);
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Returns an array of randomly sampled points.
054         * @param n the number of points
055         * @param sigma standard deviation of Gaussian position noise
056         * @return an array of random points
057         */
058        public Pnt2d[] getPoints(int n, double sigma) {
059                double dx = p2.getX() - p1.getX();
060                double dy = p2.getY() - p1.getY();              
061                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[n];
062                
063                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
064                        double x = p1.getX() + dx * i / n + rg.nextGaussian() * sigma;
065                        double y = p1.getY() + dy * i / n + rg.nextGaussian() * sigma;
066                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.from(x, y);
067                }
068                
069                return pts;
070        }
071
072}
